subject: Sales
title: The Assumptive Close
description: A quick, practical guide to The Assumptive Close.

hook.text: The salesman never asks if you'll buy. He asks 'Cash or card?' You answer before even thinking.

buildup.text: The assumptive close skips the yes-or-no question entirely. It treats the deal as already done.

discovery.text: Asking 'Do you want it?' invites hesitation. Offering a choice of how to buy bypasses doubt entirely.

twist.text: Used clumsily, it feels pushy and rude. Used naturally, it feels like confidence and service.

climax.text: The best closers deploy it so smoothly that buyers never realize a technique was used at all.

punchline.text: Skip 'Do you want it?' Ask 'How do you want it?'

quiz.question: What makes the assumptive close effective?
options: It skips the yes-or-no question by assuming the sale
